Sister of the Sword.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Give an allied follower Ward.

Skree!

—Regal Falcon

"They're ancient armaments... If they lock onto you, there's no hope of escape."

Ward.

"But I think you seem so near! Why, you're practically hovering over me!"
"That's easy for you to say. You can see us."

Its feathers are a gift to all who fly the skies. The fallen plumes refract light in different ways, each attracting its own genus of downy admirers.

"Why is there no end to war?" the maiden asked.

"Your power is limitless."

The Second Doctrine: Immerse Yourself Within
Seeking salvation from without is the origin of fault. Find the repose hidden inside and cherish it.
—Teachings of the Sleepers

Guide the lost. Spread your wings. Let your pride soar high upon the wind. Look often on the banner you carry, for it will direct you on your sacred quest.
—On the Glory of Nature
Graywing Featherfolk.evoFlair_:
People are inherently good. By nature, we are virtuous. Corruption is wrought by the hands of others. Actors have arrived, seeking to warp our innate characters. If you wish for peace, pray to be returned unto your natural state.
—Illustrious Calling, Part 1

Priestess of Foresight.baseEffect_: Fanfare: If another allied follower with Ward is in play, destroy an enemy follower. Otherwise, gain Ward.
Priestess of Foresight.baseFlair_: She is the High Priestess, font of wisdom. Though the world of man is ever-changing, she remains constant. Taking the measure of each circumstance, her decisions are wrought with careful deliberation.
Priestess of Foresight.evoFlair_: As a servant of the gods, she is called on to impart their wisdom unto mankind. The edicts are observed; the lost are guided onto the path of faith. And thus, holy salvation is delivered, efficiently and righteously.

Priest of the Cudgel.evoEffect_: Evolve: Banish an enemy follower with 3 defense or less.
Priest of the Cudgel.baseFlair_: Your evil deeds end here. You have defied God himself and there is no place to hide! I see your true form!
Priest of the Cudgel.evoFlair_: There it is! I see your weakness! My mace shall pummel it into a pulp!

Cruel Priestess.evoEffect_: Evolve: Subtract 2 from the Countdown of an allied amulet.
Cruel Priestess.baseFlair_: Welcome to the Devil's flock. Now it's time to prove your loyalty and offer your eternal soul to the master!
Cruel Priestess.evoFlair_: Heh-heh, I acknowledge your prayers of desperation. Now do as the Devil asks of you, and unleash the greed within your hearts. Soak this world in blood!

Golden Eagle.baseEffect_: Fanfare: If an allied follower with Ward is in play, gain Storm.
Golden Eagle.baseFlair_:
We slew the villain controlling the earth and took back our bountiful lands. I only wish our scattered countrymen had been there to see it.
—Battles of the Holy Knights, Chapter 6
Golden Eagle.evoFlair_: We managed to slay the villain controlling the heavens. We took back the skies. Some "heroes of hope." So many of us died. So many sacrifices. —Battles of the Holy Knights, Chapter 7

Holylight Convert.baseEffect_:
Ward.
Fanfare: Enhance (8) - Summon a Holylight Convert.
At the start of your opponent's turn, gain +2/+0 for each allied follower with Ward in play.
Holylight Convert.evoEffect_:
Ward.
At the start of your opponent's turn, gain +2/+0 for each allied follower with Ward in play.
Holylight Convert.baseFlair_: Which is stronger, a prayer or a sword? Pray when someone's got cold steel pressed to your throat, and you'll find the answer real quick. But, when you keep praying—every day—something happens... You embrace this thing called faith, and that can conquer any blade.
Holylight Convert.evoFlair_: With faith comes light—and mettle. You know, you remind me of myself, back when I believed only in the kind of strength you can see. But let me show you something. Faith can shatter even the tempered blade, and it is dazzling.

Pegasus Dullahan.baseEffect_:
When this follower comes into play, restore 2 defense to all other allied followers.
Last Words: Give a random allied Countdown amulet Last Words: Summon a Pegasus Dullahan.
Pegasus Dullahan.evoEffect_: Last Words: Give a random allied Countdown amulet Last Words: Summon a Pegasus Dullahan.
Pegasus Dullahan.baseFlair_: To be revered and honored didn't suit him, so he threw it away—just to remain the way he was.
Pegasus Dullahan.evoFlair_: Even lauded as a hero he found himself lost, so he threw it away and found it again—a way to protect the world in the way he was.

Apostle of Repose.evoEffect_:
Bane.
At the end of your turn, if this follower didn't attack this turn, randomly destroy an enemy follower with the highest attack in play.
Apostle of Repose.baseFlair_: I pray for guidance as I venture into the deepest slumber. Awaken to the blazing light of morning, and you will find only suffering. We yearn for the sleep that will continue long into the future.
Apostle of Repose.evoFlair_:
The Third Doctrine: Awaken Not
Do not teach your brethren to awaken, for unbroken sleep is in itself salvation.
—Teachings of the Sleepers

Sonia, Protector of Hope.baseEffect_:
Ward.

Can't be targeted by enemy spells and effects.

Ward.
Can't be targeted by enemy spells and effects.

I'm pleased to say it's going to be another perfect day of beating back any menace that... What? You fell into a hole? I'm on my way!
Sonia, Protector of Hope.evoFlair_: Weather: perfect. Monsters: slain. Now, Your Majesty, if you'll give me your hand. I'll make sure no evil befalls you. So long as I'm by your side... A-are those meteors falling from the sky?!

Whenever your leader's defense is restored, deal 2 damage to all enemy followers.

"Kel, are you hurt?"
"Sure am! But I've blown them away with double the pain!" ―Conversation between Elana and Kel
Kel, Holy Marksman.evoFlair_:
"Something tells me why there's always a conflict."
"Don't sweat it! I'll buff up and wipe this fight out!"
"That's not what I meant, but... Oh, dear God..." ―Conversation between Elana and Kel

Marwynn, Omen of Repose.evoEffect_: This follower can't take more than 3 damage at a time.
Marwynn, Omen of Repose.baseFlair_: The truest evil is the self, where fear, negligence, exploitation, and weakness take root. Confront them. Refuse to awaken; let your mind venture into the deepest slumber. For this is the trial that I now present the world.
Marwynn, Omen of Repose.evoFlair_: Only the ignorant seek that which is outside the self. Are you prepared to unravel the secrets of repose, to fade into the deepest slumber, and trample on what you may find? For this is the trial that I now present the world.

Ward.

Holy Lion of Salvation.evoFlair_: Salvation comes to those who save themselves. This is but one answer, for the path to salvation is ever-stretching. Start your journey from this understanding, and work toward realizing your own salvation. —Chapter 11, Path to Salvation

Limonia, Flawed Saint.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Enhance (6) - Gain the ability to evolve for 0 evolution points.

Limonia, Flawed Saint.baseFlair_: The gods have stopped responding. Now the congregation relies on her, for she guides her flock to sure salvation using those blessed metal scales. She is a saint, no doubt, but the worshippers have come to believe in her more than the gods. —Church Records, Part 4
Limonia, Flawed Saint.evoFlair_:
Abnormalities detected in proselytization protocol. Continue?
There are gods in machines. In people too. But that doesn't mean much. I will take the place of your gods and shower you with true deliverance.

Imina, Mad Eidolon.evoFlair_: When a believer offers sacrifices, the divine shows his form. Having propagated the faith through mantras—still branded on the heretic's mind—he announces the world's end.  —Den of Madness, Unexpurgated edition

Ward.

"Elana, are you still praying?"
"Yes. Because I might be tiny, but if my prayers reach God..."
―Conversation between Elana and Kel
Elana, Purest Prayer.evoFlair_:
"You oughta pray we kick the bad guys' butts!"
"Um, I think that it's better if no one gets hurt."
"You've sure got a good head on your shoulders."
―Conversation between Elana and Kel

Daffodil, Meus Princess.baseFlair_:
Rely on others during difficult times. Know that you are not alone. As long as your heart is pure, your path will be made clear.
—Book of Eulogies on Nature
Daffodil, Meus Princess.evoFlair_: "Heed my call, valorous Meus! I implore you to come at once!" The Meus military rushes to the aid of Princess Daffodil. "It is time to fulfill your calling and help reclaim our glorious kingdom! To arms!"

Manifestation of Repose.baseEffect_: Randomly put 3 different cards that cost 2 play points or less from your deck into your hand.
Manifestation of Repose.baseFlair_: Naught exists beyond here, for herein repose awaits you.

Fully restore all damaged allied followers' defense.
Deal X damage to all enemy followers. X equals the total amount of defense restored.

Pious Fox.baseEffect_:
Countdown (1)
Last Words: Summon a Guardian Fox.
Pious Fox.baseFlair_: The moonlight coalesces, taking shape as a holy fox that brims with innocence.

Fiery Paean.baseEffect_:
Countdown (2)
Fanfare: Summon a Holyflame Tiger.
Last Words: Deal 2 damage to a random enemy follower.
Fiery Paean.baseFlair_:
Salvation will come twice.
The first time, through prayer.
The second, after prayers have been forgotten.

Holybright Altar.baseEffect_:
Countdown (1)
Fanfare: If an allied follower with Ward is in play, subtract 1 from this amulet's Countdown.
Last Words: Summon a Holywing Dragon.
Holybright Altar.baseFlair_:
There's no such thing as a pointless prayer. Though you might think they're not listening, the gods hear each and every one.
—Holy Mage

Death Sentence.baseEffect_:
Countdown (1)
Last Words: Destroy 2 random enemy followers.
Death Sentence.baseFlair_: You who renounce your god's name will be granted only death in return.

Iron Maiden.baseEffect_:
Countdown (2)
At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy follower. It can't attack next turn.
Iron Maiden.baseFlair_: Those who were purged of "sin" within her became "saints" who cannot help but uphold their vows of silence. —An excerpt from The Nature of Virtue

Opposing Statues.baseEffect_:
Countdown (2)
Fanfare: Choose - Summon a Holy Fowl of Ivory or Hexed Fowl of Ebon.
Last Words: Put an Opposing Statues into your hand if you have 3 cards or less in your hand.
Opposing Statues.baseFlair_: Choose, you of many sins. Will conviction be your salvation, or will salvation be your conviction?

Countdown (3)
Fanfare and Last Words: Destroy a random enemy follower.

Countdown (1)
Fanfare: Summon a Heaven's Golem.
Last Words: Destroy all allied Heaven's Golems.
Ancient Protector.baseFlair_: The protector was created in the days of yore, an age long forgotten. —Teachings of the Priestess of the Column

Healing Priestess.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Restore 1 defense to all allies.
Healing Priestess.baseFlair_: I can see that you're wounded. Please rest here for a while. I would never forgive myself if you returned to battle in such condition.
Healing Priestess.evoFlair_: We, the servants of the Heavenly Father, are the only ones who remain to help those who need us. And so we will not rest—not until this war finally ends.

Pinion Prince.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Subtract 1 from the Countdown of an allied amulet.
Pinion Prince.baseFlair_: My wings beat for you, O pure of heart! May the wind carry my prayers aloft!
Pinion Prince.evoFlair_: I take to the skies for the pure of heart! O mighty wind, rend my foes asunder!

Lycaon.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Deal 2 damage to an enemy if there are at least 2 amulets in your hand.
Lycaon.baseFlair_: His hands became paws, and his form became monstrous. But he did not abandon god, and neither did he stop praying.
Lycaon.evoFlair_: To theists, he was the perfect believer. To atheists, he was the perfect maniac.

Angelic Idol.baseEffect_:
Ward.
Can't attack.
When an allied amulet is destroyed during your turn, evolve this follower.
Angelic Idol.baseFlair_: It presents itself to those devoted to prayer, and remains unseen to the faithless. Whether it is real or an illusion does not matter. Who is to know what is actually true? —Regarding Faith, Chapter 2
Angelic Idol.evoFlair_: Devout adherent, you believe the truth you know to be right—but can anyone prove the world you perceive to be true? Not all truths are absolute, some may even be false. —Regarding Faith, Chapter 5

Featherfolk Gardener.baseEffect_:
Fanfare: Subtract 1 from the Countdown of an allied amulet.
During your turn, if an allied amulet is destroyed, evolve this follower.
Featherfolk Gardener.baseFlair_: Do it, slack off, do it, slack off... You can decide a lot of things by picking the petals off of flowers. For example, I don't have to work very hard today.
Featherfolk Gardener.evoFlair_: Slack off, do it, slack off, do it... Ah, what do we have here? A trespasser? Well, unfortunately for you, the flowers have decided I have to be a dedicated guardian today.

Steelwing.baseEffect_:
Rush.
Strike: Summon an Assembly Droid.
Steelwing.baseFlair_: Core mutations have led to one new discovery after another. Prayers to God will serve as further salvation for both people and birdfolk. Ironknuckle Nun received new arms, and he received new wings. ―Notes from a Priory, Vol. 1
Steelwing.evoFlair_: What's important is to save everyone you can reach. But there's nothing wrong with flying. You go quick, and the view's great! I don't know why I fly! I've just got the spirit! ―Steelwing to Ironknuckle Nun

Greatsword Sister.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Put a random amulet from your deck into your hand.
Greatsword Sister.baseFlair_: "My sword serves as a powerful talisman." Her soft smile is enough to convince any traveler that her impossibly large sword is nothing more than a protective charm.
Greatsword Sister.evoFlair_: "My sword serves as a powerful talisman." Her delighted smile is enough to alert any demon that her impossibly large sword is meant for purging evil.

Calm Featherfolk.baseEffect_:
Crystallize (1): Countdown (4)
Last Words: Summon a Calm Featherfolk.
----------
When this follower comes into play, restore 3 defense to your leader.
Calm Featherfolk.baseFlair_: One day, our prayers will bear fruit. Only God knows what fruit that will be, or how it will taste. Prayer is the act of enduring while keeping faith in God's justice.
Calm Featherfolk.evoFlair_: Even should our prayers be granted in a different form than we expect, there is no cause to grieve. The time you spent in prayer has made you more just. Allow me to show you the strength which prayer and perseverance nurtures.

Greater Priestess.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Subtract 1 from the Countdown of all allied amulets.
Greater Priestess.baseFlair_: Those who dwell in the human realm, heed my words: love thy neighbor, and have faith. Faith is the path that leads to all answers.
Greater Priestess.evoFlair_: A world without love is a world without light. A world filled with love is a world without darkness. To battle against the encroaching shadows, we must all love our neighbors.

Cleric Lancer.baseEffect_:
Ward.
Gain +4/+0 during the opponent's turn.
Cleric Lancer.evoEffect_:
Ward.
Gain +4/+0 during the opponent's turn.
Cleric Lancer.baseFlair_: I am a proud warrior entrusted to protect this church from harm. My duty is to eradicate evil and defend all that is holy!
Cleric Lancer.evoFlair_: Enemies may amass in mighty armies, but this lance shall pierce them all! I have nothing to fear. All evil will be eradicated!

Shrine Knight Maiden.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Give all allied followers resistance to targeted enemy spells and effects.
Shrine Knight Maiden.baseFlair_: Prostrate yourself. Knights such as I should not have to taint ourselves by association with the likes of you.
Shrine Knight Maiden.evoFlair_: I do not wish to look at you any longer. But I'll at least cut you down in one stroke so you don't have to suffer.

Radiance Angel.baseEffect_:
Fanfare: Restore 3 defense to your leader.
Draw a card.
Radiance Angel.baseFlair_: Today the world is full of people who have lost their way. Ignored, they will be swallowed by the dark. I must offer them guidance.
Radiance Angel.evoFlair_: My guidance is not an answer, but perhaps it can help people to find their own way. Assisting in this way is my duty.

Ancient Lion Spirit.evoEffect_: Evolve: Deal 2 damage to all enemy followers.
Ancient Lion Spirit.baseFlair_: The lion god descended to the corrupted earth to roar out its rebuke of life impure and demonic.
Ancient Lion Spirit.evoFlair_: Freed from its bonds, the divine beast glared at its surroundings. A single infuriated roar was all it took to rend the flesh from the bones of any monsters unlucky enough to be nearby.

Gravekeeper Sonia.baseEffect_:
Ward.

Gravekeeper Sonia.baseFlair_: I stand here to protect the citizens of the city that was turned to gold. This is my one and only duty.
Gravekeeper Sonia.evoFlair_: Let them rest in peace. If you don't, I shall put you to sleep. Permanently.

Tenko.evoEffect_: Whenever an allied follower attacks, restore 1 defense to your leader.
Tenko.baseFlair_: We supernatural critters don't spare any effort to save our friends. We'll work our tails off!
Tenko.evoFlair_: The supernatural powers within me will end this mess. Just leave it to me, friend!

Things it can do: cause pain or distress.

Temple Ogre.evoFlair_:
Things it likes: raging and destroying.
Things it dislikes: everything else.
—Temple-Dwelling Ogres, Chapter 4, Section 2

Ward.

The winged crest is a symbol of freedom. A shield forged of the miracles which issue forth from God. We, the Eclair Holy Knights, will be the ones to defend against despair!
—Battles of the Holy Knights, Chapter 4
Holy Lancer.evoFlair_:
We slew the villain controlling the ocean and won back our beautiful waters. It had been a long time since we saw our people smiling.
—Battles of the Holy Knights, Chapter 5

Assault Priest.evoEffect_:

Evolve: Destroy an enemy follower that attacked last turn.
Assault Priest.baseFlair_: Priests are called "Father" for a reason! We exist to guide our congregations and keep them safe! That's why a priest's body must be honed with prayer, training, and combat!
Assault Priest.evoFlair_: My body is armored in divine muscle. These fists are tools of heaven! Come, sinners, and repent! You will find absolution in the moment of impact!

Rush.
Strike: If you have more evolution points than your opponent, reduce damage to this follower to 0 until the end of the turn.

Rush.
Strike: If you have more evolution points than your opponent, reduce damage to this follower to 0 until the end of the turn. (You have 0 evolution points on turns you are unable to evolve.)
Master Adjudicator.baseFlair_: I've no need of your confessions. Bear in mind that I am not the one who wields the spear—I merely provide the power to do so. It is up to the gods to determine those who are guilty. I only ensure that their will is carried out. So please, save your grievances for them.
Master Adjudicator.evoFlair_: There is no absolution. I know not what sin you have committed, nor why the gods are incensed with you. I simply enforce divine judgment. But if the heavens above have deemed you evil, then you must accept your fate.

Ward.

Ward.

During your turn, whenever your leader's defense is restored, summon a Snake Priestess.

Reverend Adjudicator.evoFlair_: He is the teacher, keeper of keys to the realm divine. Though he passes judgment on those who would violate the law, he bears kindness in his heart and is wont to grant mercy in equal measure.

Eidolon of Madness.evoEffect_:

Eidolon of Madness.evoFlair_: It is only when they lift their heads and raise their eyelids that people finally notice... But by then it's too late. It seems that people rely on mad gods in the hope of becoming mad themselves. —Reverence and Madness, Chapter 14

Ceryneian Hind.evoFlair_: This steadfast follower of god has a mirror image. At times it releases light, and at times it absorbs it. It is the Ceryneian Hind of light and dark.

The Untrue God.baseFlair_: It was a revelation from the resplendent one. He chose me to speak of the true nature of this world. Him, a god with words to spread. And for that, the past me has died! I raise this body to you! Now deliver us! —Words of Revelation
The Untrue God.evoFlair_: This is the era that the resplendent god has blessed us with! He will free us from our binds and drive away that which maddens us. We are but unenlightened mortals, who beseech you: help us! —Words of Revelation

Saren, Orphanage Matron.baseEffect_:

Saren, Orphanage Matron.evoEffect_: Evolve: Subtract 3 from the Countdown of an allied amulet.

Saren, Orphanage Matron.evoFlair_: I have a home to return to—a family to protect. To preserve that happiness, there's no job too tough. Not that I'd mind a break every now and again...

Justine, Holy Al-mi'raj.evoFlair_:
Looks like we've got a meddler on our hands. You know, I never liked rabbits. But still I admire that clueless compassion of yours. So I'll let you in on a little secret. Those fists of yours? They won't change anything.
—Vice, Death Grip

Garuda, Wings of Paradise.baseFlair_: Let this blessing engulf the skies. The flightless shall take flight; the faithless shall find faith. You have reached paradise. And here, there shall be unbroken peace—I swear it on my golden spear.
